Posts.Content: Hi there, My friend just recently got diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. He had a  PET scan done the other day and found out the cancer had spread to the adreanal glands, spine, liver, lungs to name a few.  The write up from the PET Scan read as follows: Chest:  There is an irregular hypermetabolic mass in the left lower ad left hilar region extending into the subcarinal space, measuring approximately 3.0 cm, SUV 5.7.  Multiple hypermetabolic reticular nodular densities are demonstrated in the left upper lobe.  Hypermetabolic lymphadenopathy is demonstrated in the left hilum measuring 1.8 cm, the subcarinal space measuring 3.0 cm, SUV 5.0, the pretracheal space measuring 1.0 cm, SUV 7.8, the aortopulmonary window measuring 1.0 cmm, SUV 7.8 and the right internl mammary chain and anterior pericardium measuring up to 1.0 cm.  Bilateral bullous is demonstrated in the apices. Can you please explain some of this for me to explain to him.' Thank u in advance.  Tammy
Posts.Title: Pet scan results I do not undserstand at all, please help me understand it
